name: Md. Zarif Ul Alam
highlights:
Machine Learning Engineer & Researcher
I love to solve engineering & research problems that make a difference!

experience.about: Chaldal Ltd. is a consumer product-based software company that serves over a million people every year. The leading online platform for grocery and delivery in Dhaka, Bangladesh, Chaldal is funded by Y Combinator, IFC, 500 Global.

description: Developing an in-house personalized recommender system from the ground up for the leading online platform for grocery and delivery in Dhaka, scaling it to serve more than one million users. </br>

Created an AB testing framework for the recommender system that is able to handle quick experiment iterations with no downtime! It is used to evaluate the performance of different recommendation models in production. Currently used to test on 200K+ customers. </br>

experience.about: ICT Cell BUET is responsible for making softwares for Bangladesh University of Engineering and Technology's custom use cases

description: Successfully developed a comprehensive online portal for advance payment application and tracking for the office of DAERS.</br>

Co-led the backend development efforts. Designed and implemented the backend from scratch to production, using Django Rest Framework, PostgreSQL, and Docker, according to the client's custom need and workflow.</br>
The portal has improved efficiency and transparency of the legacy application process.</br>

experience.about: Unilever Bangladesh Limited is a consumer goods company based in Dhaka, Bangladesh and founded in 1964, engaged in the manufacture and distribution of home care products, personal care products, and foods. It is a joint venture of the Government of Bangladesh and Unilever.

roles.title: Machine Learning Intern, Unilever Forecast Engine

info.description: Collaborated closely with a dynamic team which developed a new forecasting model for Unilever Bangladesh. Applied data engineering techniques to refine and process raw sales data, contributing to a more accurate and insightful forecasting system. </br>

publications.title: Quartet Fiduccia–Mattheyses revisited for larger phylogenetic studies
publications.authors: Sharmin Akter Mim, Md. Zarif Ul Alam, Rezwana Reaz, Md Shamsuzzoha Bayzid, M Saifur Rahman

other_experience.about: BUET, a public university in Bangladesh, emphasizes on engineering and technology. It has a comprehensive Computer Science and Engineering program. The Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) of BUET is the first department of its kind in Bangladesh and leading the way in research and innovation.

description: Automated Analysis of Parkinson’s Disease with Remote Tasks:

Developed PULSAR, an innovative automated PD screening tool using Positive Unlabeled Learning that uses webcam-recorded videos, addressing noisy data in healthcare and improving accessibility to diagnosis.
[Lead Investigator]
[Under Review in AAAI '24]
Quartet Fiduccia–Mattheyses revisited for larger phylogenetic studies:

Our proposed method QFM-FI, a faster and improved version of the QFM algorithm, can amalgamate millions of quartets over thousands of taxa into a species tree with a great level of accuracy. This also achieves a speedup of 20,000x compared to its predecessor.
Worked on providing a theoretical analysis of the running time and memory requirements of QFM-FI.
[Accepted in Bioinformatics (Oxford University Press)]

other_experience.about: Xu Lab aims to use cutting-edge computation techniques, particularly those related to computer vision and machine learning, to build structural organization models that would be useful for getting new insights into the machinery of cellular systems

description: Worked on developing a semi-supervised framework for 3D particle picking from macromolecular samples, which is able to detect particles directly from subtomogram.
[Co-lead Investigator]
[Manuscript in preparation for RECOMB '24]

other_experience.company: Big Data Intelligence (BDI) Lab, Auburn University
other_experience.about: Big Data Intelligence Lab working on AI and Big Data to solve real world problems

description: Co-developed a software tool called One Pass Sentence Embedding Clustering. This tool efficiently clusters short text streams using a unique one-pass algorithm that calculates similarity scores based on sentence embeddings. It was used as an internal tool to cluster questions in online classes at Auburn.

education.about: BUET, a public university in Bangladesh, emphasizes on engineering and technology. It has a comprehensive Computer Science and Engineering program. The Department of Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) of BUET is the first department of its kind in Bangladesh and leading the way in research and innovation.

description: “Automated Analysis of Parkinson's Disease with Remote Tasks”

Created a subset C compiler from scratch! Implemented a Ray Tracing pipeline, wrote an Active Queue Management algorithm for Network Simulator 3, created a paging framework for Xv6 Operating System, implemented vectorized conv nets from scratch and many more!
A tech interview preparation platform. Here the users can not only solve problems that are asked in interviews of different software companies,
but can also take assesments and earn different badges to showcase their skills. They can also discuss about interview problems and many more topics!

research.projectName: Automated Analysis of Parkinson's Disease with Remote Tasks

supervisors.name: Dr. Mohammad Saifur Rahman
supervisors.designation: Associate Professor, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, BUET

description: Parkinson’s disease (PD) is a degenerative brain disorder that is usually observed among elderly people with symptoms like shaking, slowness and stiffness, difficulty with walking and balance.

In general neurologists examine PD suspect patients where the patients are asked to perform some motor neuron tasks. The research goal of this project is to use computer vision techniques to do this diagnosis remotely using a simple automated online screening tool. In developing countries like Bangladesh, neurologists are scarce compared to the number of patients and a tool like this will enable people to get timely diagnosis and subsequent healthcare.

research.projectName: Occam's Razor Strikes Again: Revisiting Short-Text Stream Clustering with Latest Sentence Embeddings

supervisors.name: Dr. Anindya Iqbal
supervisors.designation: Professor, Department of Computer Science and Engineering, BUET

supervisors.name: Dr. Shubhra Kanti Karmaker
supervisors.designation: Assistant Professor, Department of Computer Science and Software Engineering, Auburn University, Alabama

description: We developed a new software tool called One Pass Sentence Embedding Clustering (OPSEC)
that is designed to efficiently cluster short texts. This tool uses a unique one-pass algorithm that utilizes
similarity scores based on sentence embeddings. Our experiments with well-known benchmark datasets have shown
that this software outperforms current state-of-the-art methods in terms of both accuracy and quality of clustering
for short text streams.
